section.para: Invoices and credit notes are up uploaded, linked and interfaced to a product called Factor Pro. These details can then be made available to the .
Factoring allows you to initiate your Advance Payment Requests against credit notes in Factor Pro, and submit them.

You can also access the list of all the currently Pending Transactions, including the Factoring that have been submitted to the bank but not yet acknowledged by it. The existing transactions can be inquired through the dedicated Inquiry function.

The list of transactions that are not submitted to the bank and that the user may want to purge as well as old transaction records purged by the issuing bank can be removed from the system with the FA Maintenance menu item.

section.title: Terminology
section.para: Within this section of the help guide, the terms "FA", "Advance Payment requests" and "Factoring" are used interchangeably. The terms "record" and "transaction" both refer to entries in the system relating to the function being discussed.

section.title: Factoring Functions
section.para: The menu for this module has the following groups of functions.

listitem.para: Enter the details of a new Advance Payment request.
View Client Availability, Debtor, Ivoive Overdue analysis and Client transaction details uploaded from Factor Pro.
Display a list of Advance Payment requests that have not been actioned.
List all approved advance Payment requests.
Maintain Unsigned, Purged and Rejected Advance Payment Requests

section.title: Advance Payment Request
section.para: This section describes the Advance Payment Request part of the menu and the forms it uses. The initial screen in this function displays a list of account types that can be selected for requesting advance payments. This list can be searched by entering search criteria in the Entity, Client Code, Account Type or Advance Currency fields. To display all records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields. This information has been uploaded to the portal through The Factor Pro upload interface.

The columns returned in the list of stuff are the following:
Field
Description
Client Code
The available Client codes
Account Type
The Account types available to the Client.
Advance Currency
The Currency of the account.
Click on the Client Code field to select the required Account for the Advance request.

section.title: Advance Payment Request Form
section.para: After selecting the required account type, the Advance Payment Request form is displayed. The field on this form are described in the following sections.

section.title: Advance Payment Request Form - General Details

entry.para: The Company entity associated with the selected Account Type.
The Client Code associated with the selected Account Type.
The name of the selected Account Type.
The Currency code associated with the Account type
The total draw down amount available as at the displayed date.
Click the 'Retrieve' button to display the latest available amount to draw down.
Tick this box to draw down the maximum available amount.
Enter the required amount to draw down, if the maximum is not required.

section.para: Note: Authorisations will be checked to ensure the user has the authority to draw down the requested amount.

section.title: Advance Payment Request - Retrieve Draft
section.para: This option allows Advance Payment Request records that you or another user have already started and saved, to be completed.

When selected, this option will present a list of Advance Payment Request records that have been prepared and saved by users in your bank, but not yet submitted to the clients because the input user either did not try to submit or had insufficient privileges.
Click in the System Id column to open a message for further editing.

section.title: Advance Payment Request - Retrieve Unsigned
section.para: This option allows Advance Payment Request records that you or another user have already started but been unable to submit, to be submitted by an authorised user.

When selected, this option will present a list of Advance Payment Request records that have been prepared and saved by users in your bank, but have not been successfully submitted to the clients because the user had insufficient privileges. Records that were simply saved with no attempt to submit them are not included.
Click in the System Id column to open the record in a non-editable mode, in order to review the data and perform the submission.

If you have sufficient authorisation in your profile, you can submit multiple records in a single operation directly from the list. Each record in the list has a check box which you tick to select it. A button at the end of the page submits all the selected records.

The result of the action is then returned, with a list of records that have now been successfully sent to the clients, together with a list of records that have again failed validation. The updated list of unsigned records is then also displayed.

section.title: Pending FAs
section.para: This function will display a list of all Advance Payment Request records that have not been approved by the bank. These can be edited or submitted as required by any user with the appropriate authorities.
The list can be searched by entering search criteria in the System Id, Entity or CCY fields. To display all records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.
There is also a field where you can select an Output Format for the results:

listitem.para: Screen (default) returns the list of matching records on the same page with the usual sorting features.
CSV downloads the report to your machine as Comma-Separated Values file.
Spreadsheet downloads the report to your machine as a Microsoft Excel compatible file.

section.para: You would typically use the CSV or SpreadSheet option if you want to export the list as a report to use it or customize it further in your office productivity tools. When the browser displays the File Download prompt, you can choose to save the file (whose default name is pendingIP.xxx) or directly open it which will launch Excel if it is available on your workstation.
The columns returned in the list of system are the following:

Field
Description
System Id
Unique reference number generated by for this file, when it was initiated.
Entity
The Entity associated with the transaction.
Type
The type of record. (New, etc.)
Status
The status of the FA. (Incomplete, Draft, Etc.)
CCY
The Currency of the FA.
Amount
The amount of the FA.
Input
The User that created the FA.
To edit the record, click on the edit button on the left of the list. Only records that have not been sent to the bank (authorised) can be edited. All other records can be reviewed only.

section.title: FA Inquiry

There is also a field where you can select an Output Format for the results:

section.para: You would typically use the CSV option if you want to export the list as a report to use it or customize it further in your office productivity tools). When the browser displays the File Download prompt, you can choose to save the file (whose default name is pendingEL.xxx) or directly open it which will launch Excel if it is available on your workstation.
The list is not displayed until you have entered search criteria and clicked Search. To display all records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.

section.title: FA Maintenance
section.para: This function is user to maintain Factoring records that were created, but are no longer required in the system.

section.title: FA Maintenance - Unsigned FAs
section.para: List and optionally delete unsigned (unauthorised) Factoring transactions.

When you select this option, you are presented with a list of records that are unsigned (unauthorised). You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction, and can only use its data for inquiry purposes.
You can delete one or more records in a single operation placing a tick in the check box on the left of the entry, and clicking the Delete selected transactions button at the bottom of the page.

section.title: FA Maintenance - Purged FAs
section.para: List and optionally delete Factoring transactions that have been marked as Purged by the Issuing Bank's Trade Services team. You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction, and can only use its data for inquiry purposes.
You can delete one or more records in a single operation placing a tick in the check box on the left of the entry, and clicking the Delete selected transactions button at the bottom of the page.

section.title: FA Maintenance - Rejected FAs
section.para: List and optionally delete Rejected transactions.

When you select this option, you are presented with a list of Factoring records that were submitted, but rejected by the bank and have a status of "Not Processed". You cannot initiate further amendments or messages on such a transaction, and can only use its data for inquiry purposes.
You can delete one or more records in a single operation placing a tick in the check box on the left of the entry, and clicking the Delete selected transactions button at the bottom of the page.
